content: I am generating lean4 code, and would like to add a _ => default catch-all to my definitions, because some are partial. But then I get the “redundant alternative” error message. Can I somehow turn that off or into a warning?
Yes, there is a helper syntax commonly used in macros: https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/blob/d694bf2d09b86d6ec3f218ed03e70b6e9672f5d2/src/Lean/Elab/Quotation.lean#L431-L435
Joachim Breitner has marked this topic as resolved.
@Sebastian Ullrich Would it be possible to get that syntax for matches in general? Right now it's only for match on Syntax
Oops, I didn't even realize that... the regular match implementation certainly is more complex
